bug.author: Chuabacca
bug.summary: EOFError: Compressed file ended before the end-of-stream marker was reached
bug.description:
My internet connection was interrupted while downloading the one_shot_object_detector backgrounds. Now when I try to train a model, I get this error. I think the issues is a corrupt gzip file, but I don't know where it is located. <denchmark-code>--------------------------------------------------------------------------- EOFError Traceback (most recent call last) <ipython-input-26-307cbd9c95bb> in <module> ----> 1 model = tc.one_shot_object_detector.create(training_images, 'label')
~/venv/lib/python3.7/site-packages/turicreate/toolkits/one_shot_object_detector/one_shot_object_detector.py in create(data, target, backgrounds, batch_size, max_iterations, verbose) 62 raise TypeError("'data' must be of type SFrame or Image.") 63 augmented_data = _preview_synthetic_training_data( ---> 64 data, target, backgrounds) 65 model = _tc.object_detector.create(augmented_data, 66 batch_size=batch_size,
~/venv/lib/python3.7/site-packages/turicreate/toolkits/one_shot_object_detector/util/_augmentation.py in preview_synthetic_training_data(data, target, backgrounds, verbose, **kwargs) 51 backgrounds_tar_path = backgrounds_downloader.get_backgrounds_path() 52 backgrounds_tar = _tarfile.open(backgrounds_tar_path) ---> 53 backgrounds_tar.extractall() 54 backgrounds = _tc.SArray("one_shot_backgrounds.sarray") 55 # We resize the background dimensions by half along each axis to reduce
~/venv/lib/python3.7/tarfile.py in extractall(self, path, members, numeric_owner) 2000 # Do not set_attrs directories, as we will do that further down 2001 self.extract(tarinfo, path, set_attrs=not tarinfo.isdir(), -> 2002 numeric_owner=numeric_owner) 2003 2004 # Reverse sort directories.
~/venv/lib/python3.7/tarfile.py in extract(self, member, path, set_attrs, numeric_owner) 2042 self._extract_member(tarinfo, os.path.join(path, tarinfo.name), 2043 set_attrs=set_attrs, -> 2044 numeric_owner=numeric_owner) 2045 except OSError as e: 2046 if self.errorlevel > 0:
~/venv/lib/python3.7/tarfile.py in _extract_member(self, tarinfo, targetpath, set_attrs, numeric_owner) 2112 2113 if tarinfo.isreg(): -> 2114 self.makefile(tarinfo, targetpath) 2115 elif tarinfo.isdir(): 2116 self.makedir(tarinfo, targetpath)
~/venv/lib/python3.7/tarfile.py in makefile(self, tarinfo, targetpath) 2161 target.truncate() 2162 else: -> 2163 copyfileobj(source, target, tarinfo.size, ReadError, bufsize) 2164 2165 def makeunknown(self, tarinfo, targetpath):
~/venv/lib/python3.7/tarfile.py in copyfileobj(src, dst, length, exception, bufsize) 245 blocks, remainder = divmod(length, bufsize) 246 for b in range(blocks): --> 247 buf = src.read(bufsize) 248 if len(buf) < bufsize: 249 raise exception("unexpected end of data")
/usr/local/Cellar/python/3.7.6_1/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/3.7/lib/python3.7/gzip.py in read(self, size) 274 import errno 275 raise OSError(errno.EBADF, "read() on write-only GzipFile object") --> 276 return self._buffer.read(size) 277 278 def read1(self, size=-1):
/usr/local/Cellar/python/3.7.6_1/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/3.7/lib/python3.7/_compression.py in readinto(self, b) 66 def readinto(self, b): 67 with memoryview(b) as view, view.cast("B") as byte_view: ---> 68 data = self.read(len(byte_view)) 69 byte_view[:len(data)] = data 70 return len(data)
/usr/local/Cellar/python/3.7.6_1/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/3.7/lib/python3.7/gzip.py in read(self, size) 480 break 481 if buf == b"": --> 482 raise EOFError("Compressed file ended before the " 483 "end-of-stream marker was reached") 484
EOFError: Compressed file ended before the end-of-stream marker was reached </denchmark-code>

comments.comment: Restarting my computer solved the issue!

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/Chuabacca>@Chuabacca</denchmark-link> - I'm glad to hear that restarting your computer solved the problem. That makes sense and thanks for letting us know. You could also have run the following script: from turicreate.toolkits._pre_trained_models import _get_cache_dir print(_get_cache_dir('data')) Then deleted the directory that gets printed out. FYI - the underlying issue was fixed by <denchmark-link:https://github.com/apple/turicreate/pull/2901>#2901</denchmark-link> and that fix will be included in our next release.
Great, thanks for the info! And glad to hear that the underlying issue was addressed. Iâ€™m enjoying learning and using turi create.
